result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian S Wattley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DE will complete a psychological evaluation and complete any follow up treatment.

DE will maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. 

DE will complete a psychological evaluation and complete any follow up recommended.

90 days of conditional jail time ordered.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge. 

Sawyer County Case 22CF34 heard along with Rusk Case:

Ct 1-DE will enter a plea of Guilty.  Court will order Withheld Sentence, 3 years probation.  DE will serve one year conditional jail time with 183 days credit.  No credit for good time.  DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up recommended.  DE will pay fine/costs of $654.00.

Rusk and Sawyer cases will run concurrently.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

timeConds.notes: De will serve 90 days conditional jail time. will be allowed huber privilege.  DE may serve jail time in any county that will accept him at no expense to Rusk County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian S Wattley

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated undecided about seeking PCR

8:34 AM Defendant Brian S Wattley in court.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Brian S Wattley. DE will enter a plea to Ct 2. Ct's 1 and 3 will be DRI.  Sentence will be withheld, 2 years probation, DE will serve 90 days conditional jail time, pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge, have psychiatric evaluation and comply with any recommended follow up treatment, absolute sobriety. 

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of Guilty, finds DE guilty. 

Sawyer and Rusk cases will run concurrently.  Sentencing argument entered by parties. 

Sawyer County Case-Withhold sentence, 3 years probation.  DE will serve 1 year conditional  jail time, no good time credit, will have credit for time served of 183 days.  DE may serve his jail time in Rusk or any county that will accept him at no expense to Rusk, will have huber, complete an AODA assessment and any follow up recommended, pay costs of $654.00 total. 

Court will accept the recommended disposition of the cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:49 PM Defendant Brian S Wattley in court.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Brian S Wattley.  State calls Deputy Bryce Baier, oath administered. 3:50pm Direct by the State. Objection. Witness has identified the Defendant.  3:57pm Cross by defense. 3:58 pm Witness dismissed.  State has meet it's burden.  Court finds PC will bind over for Trial.  Set for Decision. JA to contact parties for a date the last week of July. Adj 4:01pm
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

4:02 PM Defendant Brian S Wattley in court.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appeared by video for Brian S Wattley. Atty Pollak has filed a Motion to dismiss Ct 1, court will address this at Arraignment.  DE would like to have his Attorney present for PH. Set for PH July 1, 2022 @ 4:00PM. Hearing will be held in person for all parties. Adj 4:06PM.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss Count 1, filed by Atty Brian Wattley

ADDRESS INFO for Brian S Wattley
Current: NO CURRENT ADDRESS,   (Effective: 06-09-2022)
Prior: 8550 Vickors Lane, Brooklyn Center,
Preliminary hearing on June 24, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

1:16 PM Defendant Brian S Wattley appeared by video.  Attorney Annette Barna in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appeared by video for Brian S Wattley.  Waive formal reading of the CC. DE/Atty will waive TL for PH, court instructs, accepts waiver of TL.  Set for PH June 24, 2022 @ 4:00PM. Adj 1:19pm
